properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual country music festival in Tamworth from Friday 13 January until Sunday 22 January.

Road closures will be in place for the event between Saturday 7 January and Tuesday 24 January to accommodate the event, as follows:

  • Peel St between White St and Brisbane St closed from 4am Thursday 12 January until 7pm Monday 23 January
  • Fitzroy St between Smith Pl egress and Peel St closed from 5am Tuesday 10 January until 7pm Tuesday 24 January
  • Fitzroy St between Peel St and Kable Ave closed from 11pm Saturday 7 January until 7pm on Tuesday 24 January
  • Kable Ave between Brisbane St and south of Fitzroy St closed from 5am Wednesday 11 January until noon Tuesday 24 January

Motorists travelling in the area during the festival should be aware of changed access conditions and follow the direction of traffic controllers and police on site. Motorists may experience minor delays on highways in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Test Match Cricket series – Australia v South Africa at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open approx 8:30am each morning. Finish approx 5:30pm each evening.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd for the five days of test cricket at The SCG.

Driver Avenue will close from 5:30am on Wednesday 4 January and will re-open at 9pm on Saturday 7 January. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Road.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park on sections of Moore Park Road, Lang Road, Fitzroy Street, Albion Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street from 7am to 7pm on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Sunday. These clearways will extend to 8pm on Saturday 7 January. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 7AM TO 7PM (7AM TO 8PM ON SATURDAY 7 JANUARY)

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Central Coast Mariners at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 7.45pm, finish approx 9.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Big Bash League: Sydney Thunder v Perth Scorchers at Sydney Showground Stadium from 6.30pm, finish 9.30pm

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Cricket fans are encouraged to arrive early and if you have to drive, pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert and miss stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Arctic Monkeys at the Domain from 7pm to 10.30pm.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Art Gallery Rd will be closed to incoming traffic from 9pm

After the concert, roads around the Domain will also be closed from 10pm until crowds have safely cleared the area:

  • St Mary’s Rd from Prince Albert Rd to Sir John Young Cr
  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd
  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St
  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates Open: 11:15am First race at 12:20pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Juicy Festival at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open 1pm, ahead of acts start from 1.30pm, finish around 10.30pm

With thousands of fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the event. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Sydney Kings v Illawarra Hawks at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 3:45pm, finish around 5pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the eve.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Perth Scorchers at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open: 5.45pm, Start: 7.15pm, Finish: 10.15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park on Thursday evening including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match starts and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Melbourne City at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 3pm and full-time around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
United Cup at Ken Rosewall Arena, Sydney Olympic Park until Sun 8 Jan. Match times vary with morning sessions from 10am and evening sessions starting from 5:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
Big Bash League: Sydney Thunder v Sydney Sixers at Sydney Showground Stadium from 7.15pm, finish 10.15pm

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Cricket fans are encouraged to arrive early and if you have to drive, pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Cahill Expressway northbound lanes from the Domain Tunnel to the Sydney Harbour Bridge are closed from 8am Saturday 31 December 2022 to 4.30am Monday 9 January 2023 for Sydney New Year's Eve and ELEVATE Sydney on the Circular Quay Overpass.

The Cahill Walk shared path is closed from 8am Sat 31 Dec until 4.30am Mon 9 Jan.

Southbound lanes of the Cahill Expressway are also closed from 10pm Sunday 26 December until 4.30am Monday 9 January for roadwork.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour Tunnel during the closure period so allow extra travel time.
properties.diversions: Sydney Harbour Tunnel or Sydney CBD via Macquarie St, Bridge St and Grosvenor St to rejoin the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Tasmania Jackjumpers. Tip-off from 7:30pm, finish around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip. Free return shuttle buses will run.
properties.otherAdvice:
Elton John - Yellow Brick Road Tour at McDonald Jones Stadium on Sunday 8 January and Tuesday 10 January. Start both nights 7pm, finish approx 10pm both nights.

Traffic will be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as music fans travel to and from the stadium for both concerts.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Australia Day - TfNSW Interactive road closure map
Australia Day 2023  - What's On in Sydney

properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and in the evening due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Circular Quay buses will relocate to Martin Place in the evening due to road closures. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight: George St from Essex St to Lower Fort St. Sections of Argyle St, Circular Quay West, Essex St and Pitt St.
  • 7am to 10am: Hickson Rd from Napoleon St to Pottinger St, Towns Pl from Dalgety Rd to Hickson Rd, and Barton St (for Oz Day 10K wheelchair race).
  • 7am to midnight: Hickson Rd from George St to Pottinger St and OPT Elevated Rd from Hickson Rd.
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm: Cahill Expressway lanes 7 & 8 and Overpass at Circular Quay including the High St, Mount St and Domain Tunnel on-ramps and lane 4 on the Harbour Bridge. Roads in Circular Quay including sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Essex St, George St, Loftus St, Phillip St, Macquarie St and Young St. 

The speed limit on the Harbour Bridge will be reduced to 40km/h from 8pm to 9.30pm.

The Cahill Expressway overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks from 3am until midnight with additional clearways in place throughout the city on various roads between Circular Quay and Martin Place from 5pm until 10.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopen after infrastructure has been removed and cleansing has finished.

arrangementElements.html:
Special Event Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location. Clearways are in effect on both sides of the road unless specified.
